Description: Section (two fragments joined) of the upper body of a buff-coloured pottery wine-jar, the fabric is partially light-brown in section, the interior grooved, the exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as year 6 wine of the Aten domain from the western river, head vintner being Menkheperuemipet.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393515) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393515)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Domain of Aten
